data.text: @Vic_Rollison Problem is that covid control aus style causes lots of pain. Borders, lockdowns don't fix the problem and just annoy people, creating push for let it rip. Leaders need to openly take lockdowns, qurantine and borders off the table so we can can talk about long term covid control.

@louis20016 @Vic_Rollison SA did so successfully, until our governments gave up (Feds included). Maybe it depends on the population and distance from other cities. As for being told we have to live with it, we don't. We choose to live with it or that decision is forced on us by others.

@JenHogben @Vic_Rollison Western Australia tried that and failed. It’s useless trying to get to zero, the past has shown that no matter how good the measures you put in are, it will sneak though the borders. Compliance wouldn’t be as high too as people are sick of it. 

We have to live with it
@oliverjanik @Vic_Rollison Yep ... just love it when "Governments" decide COVID is "over" ... and COVID's going: "Uh, no ... I ain't ..."

@Vic_Rollison We need to aim at covid zero in the community. It can be done in SA with a short lockdown, quarantine, isolating, proper testing and contact tracing. Our government has given up, and doesn't have the will to do so. Deaths are on their head. #saparli

@ChrisEgginton @Vic_Rollison @OlssonNancy @profesterman Interesting how we went from finding even one death unacceptable, to so many as acceptable. No government seems to care about covid zero now. There's Leigh Sales answer to how many deaths are acceptable, as many as it takes.

@Vic_Rollison It feels like most world governments held a meeting and none of us were invited or clued in on the plan. Just told to enjoy the future of all covid, all the time, while we tell you nothing. And if you get severely ill or die, now or months later. It's Probably unrelated..

@Vic_Rollison Unfortunately that seems to be the case in most places. February was our 6th highest death toll month in Ireland. Now our case numbers and hospitalisations are increasing again. But the gov, media etc.. keep cramming down our throats how this is now not a concern and is good.
